page.title: 05BISHOPSBOURNE SHOP & P.O.
page.content: The combined shop and P.O. exists precariously due to the proximity of Canterbury. The owner states, "Our role is to cater for the small popul- ation and we have to be more than a stop-gap between visits to the super- markets. As well as the usual provis- ions and P.O. services, we sell news- papers and bread to order, also calor gas and paraffin which are widely used as half the village has no mains gas. The elderly rely heavily on us, whilst the younger people pop in for items forgotten in town. We store the village wheelchair, take messages and return books to the mobile library for people in their absence. The public phone box outside is well used. Often I have raided my own larder to satisfy a customer. I know people still appr- eciate a friendly personal service, rarely encountered in town stores".
